answers.text: almost exclusively above the tree line as high as 2,700 m (8,858 ft)

qas.question: Where do marmots build their colonies?
What is the most common bird found in the Alps?

context: Many rodents such as voles live <a0_0>underground<a0_0/>. Marmots live <a1_0>almost exclusively above the tree line as high as 2,700 m (8,858 ft)<a1_0/>. They hibernate in large groups to provide warmth, and can be found in all areas of the Alps, in large colonies they build <a2_0>beneath the alpine pastures<a2_0/>. Golden eagles and bearded vultures are the largest birds to be found in the Alps; they nest high on rocky ledges and can be found at altitudes of 2,400 m (7,874 ft). The most common bird is <a3_0>the alpine chough<a3_0/> which can be found scavenging at climber's huts or at the Jungfraujoch, a high altitude tourist destination.
